body_html:
What seemed to work yesterday actually still causes me problems when exporting frozen graphs.
Blacklisting global_step effectively prevents it from being turned into a constant, but it is left in the .pb file as a variable.
I need it to be either a constant or, better, removed altogether.

If I try to forcefully convert it to constant by adding global_step to variable_names_whitelist, I go back to the ValueError and invalid protobuf file problem described above.
body_text:
What seemed to work yesterday actually still causes me problems when exporting frozen graphs.
Blacklisting global_step effectively prevents it from being turned into a constant, but it is left in the .pb file as a variable.
I need it to be either a constant or, better, removed altogether.
If I try to forcefully convert it to constant by adding global_step to variable_names_whitelist, I go back to the ValueError and invalid protobuf file problem described above.
body:
What seemed to work yesterday actually still causes me problems when exporting frozen graphs.
Blacklisting `global_step` effectively prevents it from being turned into a constant, but it is left in the .pb file as a variable.
I need it to be either a constant or, better, removed altogether.

If I try to forcefully convert it to constant by adding `global_step` to `variable_names_whitelist`, I go back to the `ValueError` and invalid protobuf file problem described above.
